meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be soldered.
meanings.sent1: The solderability of the metal made it easy to join the pieces together.
meanings.sent2: The technician tested the solderability of the circuit board before proceeding with the repair.
meanings.sent3: The robot boasted about its solderability, claiming it could out-solder any human.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship had a solderability that connected people from different backgrounds effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The superhero's cape had a magical solderability that allowed it to repair itself instantly.

meanings.definition: The ability of a material to be easily soldered.
meanings.sent1: The solderability of the new alloy impressed the engineers with its efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The solderability of the wires determined the success of the electronic project.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that the banana had excellent solderability, making it a perfect conductor.
meanings.sent4: The team's unity had a solderability that held them together through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush had a solderability that seamlessly blended colors on the canvas.
